results.title: Figures in motion
results.creator_credit: Glenn Weller, Priscilla Collins, Damien Power and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
Eadweard Muybridge was the pioneer photographer whose experiments in stop-motion photography helped develop the technology that resulted in motion pictures. In this elegant fictional film, Muybridge forces his young wife to pose nude with his male lover. As the photographer begins to take his shots, he becomes more and more excited by the control he can exercise over both his lovers. An initially camp and light treatment of the erotics that forms the basis of voyeuristic desire in cinema, the film becomes progressively darker as Muybridge’s wife becomes the object of not only desire, but of appropriation and violence, signifying that even at the birth of cinema the male gaze was rapacious and pornographic.
Cast: Michael Percival, Lenore Munro, Anthony Cogin.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Glenn Weller, Priscilla Collins, Damien Power and AFTRS

results.title: Figures in motion
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Priscilla Collins and Damien Power
results.brief_description: Eadweard Muybridge was the pioneer photographer whose experiments in stop-motion photography helped develop the technology that resulted in motion pictures. In this sly and elegant short film, Muybridge forces his young wife to pose nude with his male lover. As the photographer begins to take his shots, he becomes more and more excited by the control he can exercise over both his lovers. An initially camp and light treatment of the erotics that forms the basis of voyeuristic desire in cinema, the film becomes progressively darker as Muybridge’s wife becomes the object of not only desire, but of appropriation and violence, signifying that even at the birth of cinema the male gaze was rapacious and pornographic.

In this sly and elegant short film, Muybridge forces his young wife to pose nude with his male lover. As the photographer begins to take his shots, he becomes more and more excited by the control he can exercise over both his lovers. An initially camp and light treatment of the erotics that forms the basis of voyeuristic desire in cinema, the film becomes progressively darker as Muybridge’s wife becomes the object of not only desire, but of appropriation and violence, signifying that even at the birth of cinema the male gaze was rapacious and pornographic.

As the photographer begins to take his shots, he becomes more and more excited by the control he can exercise over both his lovers. An initially camp and light treatment of the erotics that forms the basis of voyeuristic desire in cinema, the film becomes progressively darker as Muybridge’s wife becomes the object of not only desire, but of appropriation and violence, signifying that even at the birth of cinema the male gaze was rapacious and pornographic.

results.title: Figures in a landscape
results.creator_credit: Cinecrest, John Kohn and Joseph Losey
results.brief_description: A helicopter, hovering, swoops, wheels and searches like some malignant mechanical bat. Below two men, their hands tied behind their backs, flee for their lives. MacConnachie, played by Robert Shaw, is forty and Ansell, played by Malcolm McDowell, is in his early twenties. Ahead lies 400 miles of hostile terrain they must cross to escape. Between each other lies a deep mutual mistrust, but they are bound by a common need to escape and survive. MacConnachie moves by instinct and Ansell by reason. On and on the two men are hunted by the unrelenting helicopter, and unlike ordinary men who would keep running, they hunt back.

results.title: Figures in a landscape
results.brief_description: The works and methods of sculpture and stone of the contemporary abstract artist Barbara Hepworth, are compared and contrasted with their natural influences in the rocks and landscape of Cornwall.

results.title: Figure skating
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Peter Jones and Ernest Reid
results.brief_description: An invitation to experience the thrill of spinning, jumping, skimming, and dancing on winged feet. The film shows how Canada’s champions do it. Maria and Otto Jelinek, Don Jackson, Wendy Griner and Don McPherson appear briefly in dazzling exhibition, but the main object of the film is to show that figure skating is for everyone - children, young people, and adults.

results.title: Fighting Warrior for Commodore 64
results.material_description: Cassette tape computer game. Cassette, cover & manual insert in clear plastic cassette case
results.brief_description: Fighting Warrior [computer game] for Commodore 64. Fighting Warrior is a single player side scrolling fighting game. Players have a high, mid and low attack, jump, duck and step back and must fight oncoming enemies in one on one combat.

results.title: Fighting the cattle tick
results.brief_description: Shows how new knowledge of the cattle tick has led to more efficient methods of control by pasture spelling and strategic dipping.
results.description: Shows how new knowledge of the cattle tick has led to more efficient methods of control by pasture spelling and strategic dipping.
description_for_label: Shows how new knowledge of the cattle tick has led to more efficient methods of control by pasture spelling and strategic dipping.

results.title: Fighting forest fires with power pumps
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly and Lawrence Cherry
results.brief_description: An instructional film on the use of power pumps in forest fire-fighting. Portable equipment, the operation of a gasoline pump, the efficient deployment of men, precautions in handling hose and equipment, and effective use of varying pressures and volumes of water are demonstrated.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly and Lawrence Cherry

results.title: Fighting forest fires with hand tools
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly and Lawrence Cherry
results.brief_description: An instructional film to demonstrate the use of hand tools in fighting a forest fire. The use of walkie-talkie communication is demonstrated. Methods of “back-firing” are described and, after the fire, “mopping-up” to prevent a renewed outbreak.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly and Lawrence Cherry
results.description: An instructional film to demonstrate the use of hand tools in fighting a forest fire. The use of walkie-talkie communication is demonstrated. Methods of “back-firing” are described and, after the fire, “mopping-up” to prevent a renewed outbreak.
